title: Ashwell’s Ember Page
description: Char-sweet ivy drapes the broken cloisters of Ashwell Monastery like mourning veils, and every stone remembers fire when rain wakes the soot within its pores. Raithe Calder and Tallen Quill tread the sunken nave where carved gutters run like constellations toward a dry cistern painted with night, the starwork still bright where heat could not reach. Ash-moths halo the Windglass Visor with pale, powdery eclipses, and ink wraiths stir in the corners, their papery skins whispering the rhythm of borrowed footsteps as they learn the travelers’ music of bone and breath. Down in the cistern’s hollow, the air cools as if held in a cupped hand, and the well of names waits, black as a pupil, ringed by a frieze of unspent vows. The Archivist of Ashwell, a gentle spirit stitched from recollection and ash, offers a bargain: a story never told for a page that remembers Vyraleth’s first covenant with the flood, a clause as sharp as glass that could sheer the false teeth off House Veyron’s new claims if read when the tide lays the Parliament’s letters bare. The well tempts with a darker ease, promising to drink Raithe’s true name and drown his hunters, yet leave him adrift from lovers and friends like a buoy cut from its rope. The wraiths listen, ready to echo gait and breath until confusion becomes capture, unless the pair can alter their cadence and make the copies stumble like bad reflections. Above them the monastery groans like an old hull taking water, a warning that the vault will not hold long once the well is troubled. The Ember Page, when coaxed from its niche, is said to glow near betrayal like an ember coaxed by breath, and the city’s future crackles in that dim red promise.
objectives: Reach the Ashwell cistern and locate the well of names.
Parley with the archivist spirit to trade an untold story for the Ember Page of the flood treaty.
Avoid or pacify ink wraiths by altering your gait and breath to confuse their copying.
Protect Tallen Quill and exit as the vault groans with collapse.

dialogue.speaker: Archivist Spirit of Ashwell
dialogue.lines: Welcome, warm voices in a house of cold echoes, where soot remembers every syllable it ever swallowed. I keep a vigil over pages that keep vigil over promises, and I cradle a leaf that remembers a treaty more faithfully than the mouths that swore it and later learned convenience. Tell me a story never given to ink or ear, a secret still warm from the heart, and I shall unpin memory from stone so that a page may walk out by your side. You may pour your true name into my well if your fear eats louder than your courage, and I will unhook hunters from your shadow, but you will drift light as ash, and emptiness will whistle through the places where love and loyalty once anchored you. Choose knowing that all covenants, even this, are priced in futures, and that even silence leaves a ledger mark in the world.

dialogue.speaker: Tallen Quill
dialogue.lines: Raithe, listen to the echo in here, how it pauses when we lie and hums when we dare the truth; the grout that glows beneath Parliament will do the same when this page is read at ebb. If we bring the Ember Page home and let it sing under the glass, the clause House Veyron bent will scream like a green stick on a fire, and even their allies will hear it. You must not buy our safety with your name, not when your life is the knot that holds friends and favors and the hope of a just reading together. I am a scribe of Mnemos and even I fear what a nameless man becomes, because a law without witness is a law waiting to be buried. We will find another coin for the spirit’s mercy, and if we must, I will pay with a story of my own that has burned my tongue for years.

dialogue.speaker: Raithe Calder
dialogue.lines: Spirit, I have a story that lives like grit under my eyelid, and I have never dared to rinse it out where anyone could see. Once I ferried a crate through the Gate’s dark throat, thinking it a mercy bound for a friend’s sick mother, and only later did I learn I had delivered teeth meant for a crown that should never bite, and the song of that metal still wakes me in the tide’s small hours. I will not give you my true name, because I have people who call me by it in worry and in laughter, and I will not make those calls fall on water. Take my shame instead, take the weight I have carried like a wet rope on my shoulder, and set your remembered page walking with me so that its light can burn away a fresher lie. Let the docks keep a man who remembers enough to hold a line and knows which debts ought to be paid in public daylight.

dialogue.speaker: Serene Khel
dialogue.lines: Raithe Calder, you are to bring me the Ember Page with your bones unbroken and your name intact, and you are to place it on the glass when the law shows its true face at low tide. Time is the true currency here, both the lost days you once tithed and the watch we must keep for the exact bell that lets justice breathe. The Conclave whispers that power sleeps beneath both Basilica and Gate, and pages like this keep it from waking in the wrong hands; remember that as you weigh boldness against blasphemy. Trust Tallen’s counsel when the ink begins to stir, for wraiths love confident striders and despise those who change rhythm like a new dancer at a wake. Return to me with the leaf and I will return to you one sealed day when the moment most needs the you that you once were.

choices.title: Speak the Buried Crate
choices.text: You square your shoulders and offer the spirit the untold weight you have carried through the city’s metal arteries, telling of the night you trudged the bypass tunnel with a crate that sang softly of teeth. You confess the lie you told yourself to make the burden lighter, and the way the gear-song crawled under your skin when the Basilica’s choirs woke the hidden tooth. You describe Iria’s code slipped into your palm like a lantern in fog, and how you sealed the memory with Mnemos because friendship is a harbor and sometimes a hiding place. You do not ask for forgiveness, because bargains here respect accounts, not absolutions, and you let the shame stand upright like a pillar that can be leaned upon. You end with a vow that the page will not vanish into a private collection or a family’s rehearsal room, but will be read where the city’s ribs can hear it and feel the truth hum.
choices.outcome: The Archivist listens with a hush that thickens the air, and when you finish, it nods as if the soot itself had settled. A niche opens like a mouth remembering a taste, and the Ember Page steps free, its ember-ink brightening as it feels the bruise of betrayal hidden in House Veyron’s additions. The ink wraiths falter when you and Tallen change your cadence to a staggered beat, your breaths mismatched on purpose so that their copying slips and tears like cheap parchment. The vault groans but holds long enough for you to shield Tallen under your buckler and make the ascent, and the ash-moths break into a lazy swirl that guides rather than blinds. You leave with the page, your name intact, and the spirit’s faint promise that the story you gave will cool into a kind of strength when next you must stand before those who profit by forgetting.

choices.title: Cast Your True Name
choices.text: The well’s black circle pulls at you with the calm of deep water, and for a moment you imagine how easy the city would become if its hunters looked past you as if at empty air. You think of your father’s patrol skiff and the false bell that tolled him into a dark the lanterns could not master, and you consider how quiet life could be without being recognized by the debts of others. Tallen’s fingers close on your sleeve and tremble, and you hear in that tremor the pages that would never carry your deeds if you let your name drown here. You lean over the lip and speak the syllables that have gathered more meaning than letters, tasting river salt and soot as you let them fall. The well drinks, and for a heartbeat you are light as ash in a gust, a person-shaped hollow where memory refuses to land, even as the spirit tilts its head in patient expectation of a different coin.
choices.outcome: The Archivist warns that names were meant to anchor, not to be spent like small change, and yet it honors the rite with grave courtesy and offers the Ember Page for Tallen’s story instead. Tallen, voice shaking, pays with a confession of his own—the trick he once played with a clerk’s ledger that spared a dock-mother a winter tithe and cost a stranger a week of warm bread—and the spirit accepts the mixture of mercy and theft as fit currency for a city that lives between flood and law. You take the page, but as you climb, you watch Iria’s face slide away in your mind like a ship at slack water, and the buckler feels lighter for the hands that no longer remember polishing it into your arm. The ink wraiths sense the gap where your pattern used to be and hesitate, allowing you to pass with a steadiness that cuts minutes off your escape, but the vault’s groan follows you like a question mark you cannot read. You emerge with the prize yet diminished, the reward intact but at a cost that will cast a long, cold shadow over the next time someone dear tries to speak your name into a crowd.

choices.title: Knot the Breath, Mirror the Step
choices.text: Instead of paying immediately, you wet the fibers of your Knot-Ring and tie a promise that your story will be spoken if the spirit grants safe passage past the wraiths whose hunger you can hear in the rasp of their pages. You and Tallen begin to walk in a braided rhythm, three steps quick, two steps slow, then a halted breath, then a sigh, building a counter-song that makes the wraiths copy a dance that does not exist in any living chest. You raise the Windglass Visor and catch the shimmer where air is thin from the fire’s old thirst, and you place your feet only on the thicker glimmers as if walking a path stitched across a torn sail. The Archivist approves of prudence married to courage and invites you to speak your story as the price, but allows the knot to hold the telling until you stand again under sky. In that moment between demand and delivery, you choose your words carefully, tasting them like salt to be measured, and you promise they will come when both page and people are safe.
choices.outcome: The wraiths lurch into mismatched echoes and snag on their own false cadence, allowing you to cross their hunting ground without the arithmetic of your gait giving you away. The Archivist releases the Ember Page like a lamp unhooded and blesses the knot as a lawful escrow, a rare courtesy within a ruin where promises often burn to ash. As the vault begins its slow complaint toward collapse, you lift Tallen by the harness and time your movements to the old rhythm of chain-song you learned at the gates, and the stone decides to wait another minute before remembering gravity. At the rim you unbind the knot and spill your story with clean edges, and the spirit bows, satisfied that debt and duty met at the same tide. You leave whole, with Tallen’s gratitude like a second shield on your arm and the page’s glow warming the pocket where you keep it from the world’s drafts.

rewards.description: Ember Page of the Original Flood Treaty (quest item)
Order of Mnemos favor: One sealed day returned from your tithe when the time is right.
Ashwell’s archivist will answer one question in a future visit.
